did.unittitle: Seymour Adelman collection of Thomas Eakins papers and photographs

bioghist.p: Thomas Eakins (1844-1916) was a Philadelphia painter, photographer, sculptor, and fine arts educator. He graduated from Central High School, studied at the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts, and then in Europe 1866-1870, notably with Jean-Léon Gérôme in Paris. Susan Macdowell Eakins (1851-1938) was a painter and student of Eakins. They were married in 1884.

scopecontent.p: This a collection of Thomas Eakins and Susan Macdowell Eakins-related photographs, correspondence, postcards and cartes de visite. Photographs includes formal and informal portraits of Thomas Eakins, Susan Macdowell Eakins, and Samuel Murray, as well some prints by Thomas Eakins. The collection includes correspondence of John Sartain and his family, Susan Macdowell Eakins and family, and Seymour Adelman and Charles Bregler. There are also postcards and cartes de visites collected by Thomas Eakins during his travels in France, Italy, and Spain. There are some copy prints of photographs by Thomas Eakins that are in other repositories.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
